issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: NULL keys should not be shuffled for inner equi joins

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A join B on A.x = B.y
can be transformed to
(A where x is not null) join (B where y is not null) on A.x = B.y

Apart from avoiding shuffling null keyed rows it also avoids issues with reduce-side skew when there are a lot of null values in the data.

Thanks to [~gopalv] for the analysis and coming up with the solution.
fields.summary: For inner joins push a 'is not null predicate' to the join sources for every non nullSafe join condition

comments.body: preliminary patch attached.

Looks like HIVE-4867 has invalidated this change set.

Will try to rebase to trunk.
[~gopalv] What do you mean by invalidated? Patch applied for me cleanly. Do you mean its not doing what it is intended to do?

[~ashutoshc]: patch applies, does not build anymore.

The patch relied on genJoinReduceSinkChild(QB qb, QBJoinTree joinTree, ... pos) as the signature for the method it was in.

QBJoinTree & pos have been removed.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12650480

More golden file updates in 6.

There seems to be a couple of issues though that are either wrong with this patch or might be exposing problems with the original code:

a) subquery transformation doesn't generate the nullsafe array (already addressed in patch)
b) join pushdown does not seem to correctly populate the nullsafe array (size(join condns) != size(nullsafe))
c) Somehow this patch seems to change ptf/windowing tests results (actual query results, not just explain)

[~rhbutani] any thoughts?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12650539

The diff in windowing queries is because of an issue with ColumnPruner for PTF and Script Operators.
[~ashutoshc] can you please look at changes to ColumnPruner.

The issue with join pushdown is that now genNotNullFilterForJoinSourcePlan is always working of the top QBJoinTree; in the original patch the joinTree was passed in, somewhere along the line this got refactored, looking into reverting.

[~hagleitn] issues a) and b) were because the check was being made against the wrong QBJoinTree.
patch.8 fixes this; I removed the null and empty checks on the nullSafes error.

FWIW, you can do the same with outer joins on inner side
R left outer join S on R.r=S.s is the same as R LOJ (select * from S where s is not null) as S on R.r=S.s
and symmetrically for ROJ.
